ticket.title: Error generating the builder-2.1.2 documentation when installing
ticket.original-body:
Got the following error when installing the builder gem on Mac OS X 10.6.2:
> $ sudo gem install builder
> Successfully installed builder-2.1.2
> 1 gem installed
> Installing ri documentation for builder-2.1.2...
> ERROR: While generating documentation for builder-2.1.2
> ... MESSAGE: Unhandled special: Special: type=17, text="<!-- HI -->"
> ... RDOC args: --ri --op /Library/Ruby/Gems/1.8/doc/builder-2.1.2/ri --title Builder -- Easy XML Building --main README --line-numbers --quiet lib CHANGES Rakefile README doc/releases/builder-1.2.4.rdoc doc/releases/builder-2.0.0.rdoc doc/releases/builder-2.1.1.rdoc --title builder-2.1.2 Documentation
> (continuing with the rest of the installation)
> Installing RDoc documentation for builder-2.1.2...
Don't think this is too serious but better mention it anyway if someone is looking for it.

ticket.original-body-html:
Got the following error when installing the builder gem on Mac OS X 10.6.2:

$ sudo gem install builder

Successfully installed builder-2.1.2

1 gem installed

Installing ri documentation for builder-2.1.2...

ERROR: While generating documentation for builder-2.1.2

... MESSAGE: Unhandled special: Special: type=17, text="<!-- HI -->"

... RDOC args: --ri --op /Library/Ruby/Gems/1.8/doc/builder-2.1.2/ri --title Builder -- Easy XML Building --main README --line-numbers --quiet lib CHANGES Rakefile README doc/releases/builder-1.2.4.rdoc doc/releases/builder-2.0.0.rdoc doc/releases/builder-2.1.1.rdoc --title builder-2.1.2 Documentation

(continuing with the rest of the installation)

Installing RDoc documentation for builder-2.1.2...

Don't think this is too serious but better mention it anyway if someone is looking for it.

version.body: Hi Simon, I have just had the very same error when doing likewise in Windows Vista. I'm hoping it's not a calling card for a hacker.
version.body-html:
Hi Simon,
I have just had the very same error when doing likewise in Windows Vista.
I'm hoping it's not a calling card for a hacker.

version.body: This is not related to Rails.

That would be most helpful. Thanks.
